snippet: After Sheldon Silver was found guilty on Monday, several jurors in the corruption case discussed how they reached their verdict.
abstract: Several jurors in trial of New York State Assemblyman Sheldon Silver were initially swayed in his favor by defense's arguments and Silver's unassuming demeanor, but changed their minds as evidence was revealed; juror Arleen Phillips remained lone holdout until last hour of trial, when unanimous guilty verdict was delivered.

byline.original: By VIVIAN YEE and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: After Sheldon Silver was found guilty on Monday, several jurors in the corruption case discussed how they reached their verdict.

headline.main: As Trial Began, a ‘Humble’ Assemblyman Didn’t Appear Guilty to Several Jurors
headline.print_headline: As Trial Began, a ‘Humble’ Assemblyman Didn’t Appear Guilty to Several Jurors
